Feature.Description: This feature enables SiLA error handling during the execution of observable commands. A client can subscribe to the property 'RecoverableErrors' which contains a list of recoverable errors that occurred and are not handled yet. If a recoverable error occurs during the execution of an observable command, a respective error object will be added to the list of the property 'RecoverableErrors'. Each error object contains the error description, the command execution UUID of the observable command execution during which the error occurred and a list of possible continuation options. To handle the error, the client sends one of the provided continuation options together with the command execution UUID, using the command 'ExecuteContinuationOption'. Within a continuation option the server can specify additional input data that has to be sent by the client in order to execute that continuation option, e.g. an adjusted parameter value. The structure of the required data has to be described in the 'RequiredInputData' field of the respective continuation option. The data must be contained in the 'InputData' field of the 'ExecuteContinuationOption' command. When the server receives the continuation option the according error object will be removed from the list of the property 'RecoverableErrors'. Instead of sending a continuation option the client alternatively can use the 'AbortErrorHandling' command (containing the command execution UUID) to stop the handling of the respective error. The server will treat this error as a 'normal' (not recovered) error using the standard error mechanism of SiLA. Via 'SetErrorHandlingTimeout' the maximum time can be specified that the server will wait for a continuation option before it sets itself into an internal error state and answers all following requests with an unrecoverable error. This can be used if an instrument must not be in a (blocked) waiting state in order to keep its functionality alive, because some service actions have to be performed within a certain time. In case of multi client access it is recommended that only one client (preferably the one that issued the according command execution) handles recoverable errors.

Property.Description: A list of all recoverable errors that occurred during execution and have not been handled yet.

Command.Description: Executes the selected option to recover the error.

Parameter.Description: The UUID of the observable command execution for which the error shall be handled.

The identifier of the continuation option to be executed. It must match the identifier of one of the continuation options specified in the 'ContinuationOptions' list of the according 'RecoverableError' object.

If required this parameter contains the data that has to be sent along with a continuation option in order to execute the requested recovery option. The kind of the data as well as the required format must be described in the 'RequiredInputData' field of the respective continuation option.

Command.Description: Executes the selected option to recover the error.

Parameter.Description: The UUID of the observable command execution for which the error handling shall be aborted.

Command.Description: Sets the maximum time that the server will wait for a continuation option in case of a recoverable error. If no continuation option is within the specified time all following requests will be answered with an unrecoverable error. A value of zero specifies an indefinite time, meaning that the server will wait till a continuation options is sent.

DataTypeDefinition.Description: Describes an error that can be recovered by error handling. It contains error information (such as the command execution during which the error occurred, the time when the error occurred and the description of the error situation) and a list of possible continuation options. One of the continuation options can be marked as default option. A timeout can be specified for the automatic execution of that option if the client doesn't send a continuation option during the specified duration.

Element.Description: The fully qualified identifier of the command whose execution produced the error.
The UUID of the observable command execution during which the error occured.
This message describes the error situation. It should contain the reason of the error and additional error handling explanation.
A list of possible options to recover the error and continue the command execution.

The identifier of a continuation option that is marked as the preferred option. It must be an identifier of one of the continuation options of the 'ContinuationOptions' list. It can also be defined to be automatically executed after a timeout specified by the 'AutomaticExecutionTimeout' element.

Specifies a timeout (in seconds) for handling the error by the client. If the client does not send a continuation option within the specified duration, the defined default option will automatically be executed. A value of 0 means, that no automatic execution will be done by the server. This timeout only takes effect if a default option is specified, otherwise it will be ignored.

DataTypeDefinition.Description: Describes a possible option to recover an occurred error.

Element.Description: The identifier of the continuation option. It must be unique within the RecoverableError object.

A human readable text describing the continuation option. It must explain all required manual actions by the operator as well as the actions that will be executed by the server and the expectable results when this option is selected. If there is additional data that can be sent along with the continuation option, the kind of the data as well as the required format must be described as well.

This field defines the structure of the additional input data that is required in order to execute this continuation option. The format is a SiLA data type definition according to the schema DataTypes.xsd. If this field is empty no additional data is required.

DefinedExecutionError.Description: The specified command execution UUID is not valid for error recovery. There is currently no unhandled recoverable error related to the specified command execution. A possibly occurred error might have been handled already by another client.
The specified continuation option is not defined for the error of the given observable command execution.
